abstract.p: Audrey Joslin letter on November 18 article about global warming urges Americans to take responsibility for reducing emissions (S)

block.p: Re ''New View of Data Supports Human Link to Global Warming'' (Nov. 18): With so many scientific alarms shouting that human activity is the reason for global warming, it is becoming more apparent that people need to take responsibility for minimizing it before the environmental damage is irreversible.

Re ''New View of Data Supports Human Link to Global Warming'' (Nov. 18): With so many scientific alarms shouting that human activity is the reason for global warming, it is becoming more apparent that people need to take responsibility for minimizing it before the environmental damage is irreversible.

As a leader in the production of green-house gas emissions, America should be leading the battle. Instead, our refusal to ratify the Kyoto treaty, the Bush administration's undermining of clean-air laws and the American love of inefficient vehicles reinforce the mentality that it's ''not my problem.''
